value.name: butane
value.description: Butane is a highly flammable, colorless gas at room temperature and pressure. It is a four-carbon alkane commonly used as a fuel for lighters, portable stoves, and as a propellant in aerosols. Its simple linear structure makes it a fundamental molecule in organic chemistry for studying conformational isomerism.

value.name: cyclohexane
value.description: Cyclohexane is a six-carbon cycloalkane that exists as a colorless, flammable liquid with a distinctive detergent-like odor. It is primarily used in the industrial production of adipic acid and caprolactam, which are precursors to nylon. In chemistry, it is famous for its 'chair' and 'boat' conformations, which minimize ring strain.

value.name: decane
value.description: Decane is a ten-carbon straight-chain alkane and a component of gasoline and kerosene. It is a colorless liquid that is highly hydrophobic and used primarily as a solvent and in fuel research. As a larger alkane, it exhibits properties typical of paraffin hydrocarbons found in heavier petroleum fractions.

value.name: ethane
value.description: Ethane is a two-carbon alkane and the second simplest hydrocarbon after methane. It is a colorless, odorless gas at standard conditions and is primarily used as a feedstock for ethylene production via steam cracking. Ethane is a significant component of natural gas and plays a vital role in the petrochemical industry.

value.name: heptane
value.description: Heptane is a seven-carbon linear alkane used as a standard for the zero point of the octane rating scale in engines. It is a colorless, volatile liquid commonly used as a non-polar solvent in laboratories and industrial processes. Its predictable combustion properties make it essential for testing fuel performance.

value.name: hexane
value.description: Hexane is a six-carbon alkane and a widely used non-polar solvent in industrial and laboratory settings. It is frequently employed to extract edible oils from seeds and as a cleaning agent for textiles and electronics. Hexane is highly volatile and flammable, requiring careful handling in industrial environments.

value.name: isobutane
value.description: Isobutane, also known as methylpropane, is a branched-chain isomer of butane. It is commonly used as a refrigerant in domestic fridges and freezers, and as a propellant in aerosol sprays due to its low environmental impact compared to CFCs. It is also a key feedstock in the production of high-octane gasoline components.

value.name: methane
value.description: Methane is the simplest alkane, consisting of a single carbon atom bonded to four hydrogen atoms. It is the primary component of natural gas and a potent greenhouse gas with significant implications for climate change. Methane is widely used as a clean-burning fuel for heating and electricity generation.

value.name: nonane
value.description: Nonane is a nine-carbon linear alkane found in petroleum and used as a component of kerosene and jet fuel. It is a colorless liquid with a gasoline-like odor and serves as a solvent in various organic synthesis applications. Its moderate boiling point makes it useful in fuel blend studies.

value.name: octane
value.description: Octane is an eight-carbon linear alkane and a crucial component of gasoline. It serves as the reference point for the 100 mark on the octane rating scale, representing high resistance to 'knocking' in internal combustion engines. Octane's structure and combustion characteristics are central to automotive fuel technology.

value.name: pentane
value.description: Pentane is a five-carbon alkane that exists as a highly volatile, colorless liquid at room temperature. it is primarily used as a blowing agent in the production of polystyrene foam and other plastics. Pentane's low boiling point also makes it an effective solvent for specific laboratory extractions.

value.name: propane
value.description: Propane is a three-carbon alkane commonly used as a fuel for domestic heating, cooking, and automotive applications (LPG). It is stored under pressure as a liquid and expands into a gas when released. Propane is also used as a feedstock in the production of propylene and other petrochemicals.

value.name: 1-butene
value.description: 1-Butene is a linear alpha-olefin used primarily as a co-monomer in the production of various types of polyethylene, such as LLDPE. It is a colorless, flammable gas that contributes to the flexibility and strength of plastic films. Its terminal double bond makes it highly reactive in polymerization reactions.

value.name: 1-hexene
value.description: 1-Hexene is an alpha-olefin consisting of a six-carbon chain with a terminal double bond. It is a key co-monomer in the production of high-performance polyethylene, enhancing properties like tear resistance and impact strength. It is also used as a precursor to plasticizers and surfactants.

value.name: butadiene
value.description: Butadiene is a highly reactive four-carbon diene with two conjugated double bonds. It is a critical industrial chemical used primarily in the production of synthetic rubbers, such as styrene-butadiene rubber (SBR) and polybutadiene. Its unique electronic structure makes it a classic subject for studying conjugated systems in chemistry.

value.name: cyclohexene
value.description: Cyclohexene is a six-carbon cyclic alkene used as an intermediate in the production of adipic acid and maleic acid. It is a colorless liquid with a sharp odor and is often used as a solvent and in the synthesis of various pharmaceutical compounds. Its ring structure provides a platform for studying addition reactions to cycloalkenes.

value.name: e-but-2-ene
value.description: (E)-But-2-ene, also known as trans-2-butene, is a four-carbon alkene where the methyl groups are on opposite sides of the double bond. This stereoisomer is more stable than its cis counterpart and is used in the production of high-octane gasoline and various petrochemical intermediates. It is a fundamental example of geometric isomerism.

value.name: e-hex-3-ene
value.description: (E)-Hex-3-ene is a six-carbon internal alkene with a trans configuration. It is used in organic synthesis and as an intermediate in the production of specialty chemicals. Its symmetric structure and internal double bond make it useful for studying the regioselectivity and stereochemistry of addition reactions.

value.name: ethene
value.description: Ethene, commonly known as ethylene, is the simplest alkene and the most produced organic compound in the world. It serves as a vital plant hormone that regulates fruit ripening and flower wilting. Industrially, it is the primary feedstock for polyethylene, the world's most common plastic.

value.name: isobutylene
value.description: Isobutylene is a branched four-carbon alkene mainly used in the production of butyl rubber and fuel additives like MTBE and isooctane. It is a colorless gas with a faint petroleum-like odor. Its branched structure makes it particularly useful for synthesizing polymers with high gas impermeability.

value.name: isoprene
value.description: Isoprene is a five-carbon diene that serves as the fundamental building block for natural rubber and many other biological molecules known as terpenes. It is produced by many plants and emitted into the atmosphere, playing a role in aerosol formation. In industry, it is used to produce synthetic polyisoprene rubber.

value.name: propene
value.description: Propene, also known as propylene, is a three-carbon alkene and the second most important starting material in the petrochemical industry after ethylene. It is predominantly used to produce polypropylene, a versatile plastic found in everything from packaging to automotive parts. It is also a precursor to many other chemicals like acetone and acrylonitrile.

value.name: styrene
value.description: Styrene is an aromatic alkene consisting of a benzene ring bonded to a vinyl group. It is a colorless, oily liquid that readily polymerizes into polystyrene, a widely used plastic and foam material. Styrene is essential for producing resins, rubbers, and many consumer products like food containers and insulation.

value.name: z-but-2-ene
value.description: (Z)-But-2-ene, or cis-2-butene, is a four-carbon alkene where the methyl groups are on the same side of the double bond. This configuration introduces slight steric strain, making it less stable than the trans isomer. It is used as a feedstock in various chemical processes and for studying the effects of molecular geometry on reactivity.

value.name: 1-butyne
value.description: 1-Butyne is a terminal alkyne with a four-carbon chain and a triple bond at the first position. It is a highly flammable gas used in organic synthesis to build more complex molecules through its reactive acidic terminal hydrogen. It is also an intermediate in the production of various specialty chemicals.

value.name: 1-heptyne
value.description: 1-Heptyne is a terminal alkyne with a seven-carbon chain, existing as a colorless liquid at room temperature. It is primarily used as a reagent in organic chemistry for the synthesis of larger molecules and pharmaceuticals. Its terminal triple bond allows for versatile chemical transformations like click chemistry.

value.name: 1-octyne
value.description: 1-Octyne is an eight-carbon terminal alkyne used as a building block in the synthesis of specialized organic compounds and surfactants. It is a clear liquid that provides a useful long-chain handle for creating hydrophobic-hydrophilic molecular architectures. It is also used in the preparation of specialized polymers.

value.name: 1-pentyne
value.description: 1-Pentyne is a five-carbon terminal alkyne used in the laboratory for the synthesis of other organic compounds and as a model molecule for studying alkyne reactivity. It is a volatile liquid and, like other terminal alkynes, features an acidic hydrogen that can be easily substituted in various reactions.

value.name: 2-butyne
value.description: 2-Butyne, also known as dimethylacetylene, is an internal alkyne with a four-carbon chain. It is a volatile liquid that is much more symmetric than its isomer, 1-butyne. Its internal triple bond is a useful feature for studying the electronic properties and bridgehead chemistry of alkynes.

value.name: 2-pentyne
value.description: 2-Pentyne is an internal alkyne with a five-carbon chain, where the triple bond is located at the second carbon. It is used as a reagent in organic synthesis and for studying the differences in reactivity between terminal and internal alkynes. It exists as a colorless, flammable liquid.

value.name: 3-hexyne
value.description: 3-Hexyne is a symmetric internal alkyne with a six-carbon chain. Its central triple bond makes it an ideal substrate for studying stereoselective reduction and addition reactions. It is used as a reagent in the production of specialized organic materials and fine chemicals.

value.name: acetylene
value.description: Acetylene, or ethyne, is the simplest alkyne and a highly reactive gas. It is most famous for its use in oxy-acetylene welding due to the extremely high temperature it produces when burned with oxygen. It is also a vital chemical building block for synthesized polymers and various industrial chemicals.

value.name: allylene
value.description: Allylene, also known as propyne or methylacetylene, is a three-carbon alkyne used as a component of MAPP gas for specialized welding and cutting. It is also being explored as a high-energy rocket fuel propellant. Its simple alkyne structure makes it a key intermediate in many chemical reaction pathways.

value.name: benzyne
value.description: Benzyne is a highly reactive and unstable intermediate consisting of a benzene ring with a formal triple bond. It exists only momentarily during certain chemical reactions and cannot be isolated under normal conditions. It is a classic example of a reactive intermediate used to explain complex aromatic substitution and addition mechanisms.

value.name: diacetylene
value.description: Diacetylene, or butadiyne, is a linear four-carbon molecule with two conjugated triple bonds. It is a highly reactive and potentially explosive gas found in the atmospheres of some moons and planets. In the lab, it is a precursor to many advanced carbon materials and polydiacetylene polymers.

value.name: ethynylbenzene
value.description: Ethynylbenzene, commonly known as phenylacetylene, is an aromatic alkyne consisting of a benzene ring bonded to an ethynyl group. It is a colorless liquid used as a building block in the synthesis of polymers, pharmaceuticals, and materials for organic electronics. Its terminal alkyne group is widely used in Sonogashira coupling reactions.

value.name: amyl_alcohol
value.description: Amyl alcohol refers to a group of eight isomeric alcohols with five carbon atoms, commonly used as solvents and in the production of fragrances and flavors. They are typically colorless liquids with a characteristic sharp odor. Amyl alcohols are also used as intermediates in the manufacture of various industrial chemicals and plasticizers.

value.name: benzyl_alcohol
value.description: Benzyl alcohol is an aromatic alcohol widely used as a solvent for inks, paints, and epoxy resins. It is also a common ingredient in perfumes and soaps due to its mild, pleasant floral aroma. In medicine, it serves as a preservative in injectable medications and as a topical treatment for head lice.

value.name: cyclohexanol
value.description: Cyclohexanol is a cyclic secondary alcohol primarily used as a precursor to adipic acid, which is essential for making nylon-6,6. It is a colorless, oily liquid that can solidify into a crystalline mass at room temperature. It is also used as a solvent for resins, dyes, and various industrial oils.

value.name: ethanol
value.description: Ethanol is the most famous alcohol, found in alcoholic beverages and widely used as a biofuel and industrial solvent. It is also a potent disinfectant and antiseptic used in hand sanitizers and medical wipes. Produced primarily by the fermentation of sugars, ethanol is a central molecule in both human culture and modern industry.

value.name: glycerol
value.description: Glycerol, also known as glycerin, is a simple triol (alcohol with three hydroxyl groups) that is a key component of all triglycerides (fats and oils). It is a sweet-tasting, viscous liquid used extensively in the food, pharmaceutical, and cosmetic industries as a humectant and sweetener. It is also a byproduct of biodiesel production.

value.name: isopropanol
value.description: Isopropanol, or isopropyl alcohol, is a common household 'rubbing alcohol' used for cleaning and disinfection. It is a highly volatile liquid that evaporates quickly, making it ideal for cleaning electronic components and as a solvent for coatings. It is also widely used in medical settings as a surface antiseptic.

value.name: methanol
value.description: Methanol, also known as wood alcohol, is the simplest alcohol and a vital industrial chemical. It is used as a fuel, a solvent, and a key feedstock for producing formaldehyde and acetic acid. While useful, it is highly toxic to humans and must be handled with extreme care to prevent poisoning.

value.name: n-butanol
value.description: n-Butanol is a four-carbon primary alcohol used extensively as an industrial solvent and as an intermediate in the production of butyl acetate, a common lacquer solvent. It has a characteristic harsh, banana-like odor and is being researched as a potential next-generation biofuel due to its higher energy density compared to ethanol.

value.name: n-propyl_alcohol
value.description: n-Propyl alcohol, or 1-propanol, is a three-carbon primary alcohol used as a solvent in the pharmaceutical and printing industries. It is also an intermediate in the synthesis of various chemical compounds like propyl acetate. It has a characteristic alcohol odor and is more effective than ethanol at dissolving many resins.

value.name: phenol
value.description: Phenol is an aromatic organic compound consisting of a hydroxyl group bonded directly to a benzene ring. It is a white crystalline solid that is a key precursor to plastics like polycarbonates and epoxy resins. Originally known as carbolic acid, it was the first widely used antiseptic in surgery by Joseph Lister.

value.name: sec-amyl_alcohol
value.description: sec-Amyl alcohol, or 2-pentanol, is a secondary alcohol isomer of amyl alcohol used as a solvent and as an intermediate in organic synthesis. It is a colorless liquid with a characteristic odor and is particularly useful in the production of specialized chemicals and pharmaceuticals. Its chiral center makes it interesting for stereochemical studies.

value.name: tert-butanol
value.description: tert-Butanol is the simplest tertiary alcohol and exists as a colorless solid or liquid at room temperature. It is a key solvent used in the production of perfumes and as a paint remover. In the fuel industry, it is used as an octane booster and as a precursor to methyl tert-butyl ether (MTBE).

value.name: 18_crown_6
value.description: 18-Crown-6 is a cyclic polyether that is famous for its ability to selectively bind potassium cations in its central cavity. This 'host-guest' interaction makes it a powerful phase transfer catalyst, allowing ionic salts to dissolve in non-polar organic solvents. It is a quintessential example of macrocyclic and supramolecular chemistry.

value.name: 1_4-dioxane
value.description: 1,4-Dioxane is a cyclic diether used primarily as a stabilizer for chlorinated solvents and as a versatile solvent in various industrial processes. It is a colorless liquid with a faint sweet odor and is highly miscible with water. However, it is also classified as a potential human carcinogen and an environmental contaminant.

value.name: 2-methyltetrahydrofuran
value.description: 2-Methyltetrahydrofuran is a cyclic ether that is gaining popularity as a 'green' alternative to traditional solvents like THF. Derived from renewable biomass resources, it is used in Grignard reactions and other organometallic processes due to its superior stability and ease of recovery. It is a key molecule in sustainable chemistry.

value.name: anisole
value.description: Anisole, also known as methoxybenzene, is an aromatic ether with an agreeable, sweet-smelling odor similar to anise seed. It is used as a precursor to perfumes, insect pheromones, and various pharmaceuticals. In the lab, it is a common solvent for organic reactions involving aromatic compounds.

value.name: dibenzyl_ether
value.description: Dibenzyl ether is a symmetric aromatic ether used as a plasticizer for nitrocellulose and as a high-boiling solvent. It is also used as a flavoring agent in the food industry and as a component in specialized lubricants. Its stable ether linkage and bulky benzyl groups provide it with unique physical properties.

value.name: diethyl_ether
value.description: Diethyl ether is a classic organic solvent once widely used as a general anesthetic. It is highly volatile and extremely flammable, often forming explosive peroxides over time. In the laboratory, it remains a common solvent for extractions and Grignard reactions due to its ability to stabilize reactive intermediates.

value.name: diisopropyl_ether
value.description: Diisopropyl ether is a branched ether used as a specialized solvent and as an extraction agent for various organic and inorganic compounds. It is also used as a fuel additive to increase octane ratings. Like other ethers, it is prone to forming dangerous peroxides and must be stored and handled with caution.

value.name: dimethyl_ether
value.description: Dimethyl ether is the simplest ether and is used as a clean-burning alternative to diesel fuel and as an aerosol propellant. It is a colorless gas that can be easily liquefied under pressure. Due to its lack of sulfur and low particulate emissions, it is considered a promising renewable fuel for the future.

value.name: ethylene_oxide
value.description: Ethylene oxide is a highly reactive cyclic ether and a critical industrial chemical. It is used primarily to produce ethylene glycol (antifreeze) and as a potent sterilant for medical equipment that cannot withstand high temperatures. Because of its reactivity, it is also a known human carcinogen and requires stringent safety controls.

value.name: methyl_tert-butyl_ether
value.description: Methyl tert-butyl ether (MTBE) is a branched ether once widely used as an oxygenate fuel additive to reduce engine knocking and air pollution. While it improved air quality, its high solubility in water led to widespread groundwater contamination, resulting in its phase-out in many regions. It remains a useful laboratory solvent.

value.name: propylene_oxide
value.description: Propylene oxide is a cyclic ether (epoxide) used as a fundamental building block for polyether polyols, which are essential for making polyurethane plastics and foams. It is a highly reactive, flammable liquid produced on a large scale. It is also used as a fumigant for certain food products like nuts and spices.

value.name: tetrahydrofuran
value.description: Tetrahydrofuran (THF) is one of the most common cyclic ethers used in the laboratory as a polar aprotic solvent. It is essential for many reactions, including Grignard and organolithium syntheses, because it can effectively coordinate with metal cations. THF is also a precursor to many important polymers like Spandex.

value.name: anthracene
value.description: Anthracene is a polycyclic aromatic hydrocarbon (PAH) consisting of three fused benzene rings. It is a colorless solid that exhibits beautiful blue fluorescence under ultraviolet light. Anthracene is primarily used as a precursor to anthraquinone, a starting material for many important synthetic dyes and pigments.

value.name: benzene
value.description: Benzene is the prototypical aromatic hydrocarbon and a fundamental building block of organic chemistry. It consists of a six-carbon ring with alternating double bonds that are actually delocalized, providing extraordinary stability. While an essential industrial chemical for making plastics and drugs, it is a potent human carcinogen.

value.name: biphenyl
value.description: Biphenyl is an organic compound consisting of two benzene rings joined by a single bond. It is a colorless solid used as a starting material for the production of polychlorinated biphenyls (PCBs) in the past, and currently as a fungicide for citrus fruits. It is also a component of many heat-transfer fluids.

value.name: chlorobenzene
value.description: Chlorobenzene is an aryl halide consisting of a chlorine atom substituted on a benzene ring. It is a colorless liquid once used widely in the production of DDT and phenol. Today, it remains an important high-boiling solvent and an intermediate in the synthesis of various pesticides and pharmaceuticals.

value.name: cumene
value.description: Cumene, or isopropylbenzene, is an aromatic hydrocarbon found in crude oil and refined fuels. Almost all cumene produced industrially is converted into phenol and acetone through the 'cumene process.' It is a clear liquid with a characteristic sharp, gasoline-like odor.

value.name: ethylbenzene
value.description: Ethylbenzene is an aromatic hydrocarbon used almost exclusively as a precursor to styrene, the monomer for polystyrene plastics. It is a significant component of the BTX (benzene, toluene, xylene) fraction of petroleum. Ethylbenzene is a colorless liquid with an odor similar to that of gasoline.

value.name: mesitylene
value.description: Mesitylene, or 1,3,5-trimethylbenzene, is a symmetric aromatic hydrocarbon often used as a solvent and as a specialty building block in organic synthesis. Its high degree of symmetry makes it a useful reference molecule in NMR spectroscopy and for creating specialized electronic materials.

value.name: naphthalene
value.description: Naphthalene is the simplest polycyclic aromatic hydrocarbon, famously used as the primary ingredient in traditional mothballs. It consists of two fused benzene rings and has a very distinctive, pungent odor. Naphthalene is also a vital precursor to phthalic anhydride, used for making plastics and dyes.

value.name: nitrobenzene
value.description: Nitrobenzene is a pale yellow oily liquid with a distinctive almond-like odor. It is primarily used as a precursor to aniline, which is essential for the production of polyurethanes, dyes, and drugs. It is highly toxic and can be absorbed through the skin, requiring careful handling in industrial settings.

value.name: p-xylene
value.description: p-Xylene is one of the three isomers of dimethylbenzene and is the most industrially important. It is used almost entirely to produce terephthalic acid, the key component of PET plastics used in beverage bottles and polyester fibers. It is a colorless liquid with a sweet, aromatic odor.

value.name: phenanthrene
value.description: Phenanthrene is a polycyclic aromatic hydrocarbon composed of three fused benzene rings arranged in a non-linear fashion. It is an isomer of anthracene and is found in coal tar and cigarette smoke. Phenanthrene's structure is a common motif in many biological molecules, including steroids and certain alkaloids.

value.name: toluene
value.description: Toluene, also known as methylbenzene, is a widely used aromatic solvent and a common component of paint thinners and glues. It is less toxic than benzene and is often used as a substitute in laboratory and industrial applications. Toluene is also a key additive in high-octane gasoline and a precursor to TNT.

value.name: acetaldehyde
value.description: Acetaldehyde is a versatile aldehyde used as a precursor to acetic acid and many other industrial chemicals. It occurs naturally in many fruits and is a primary metabolite of ethanol in the human body, responsible for many symptoms of a hangover. It is a volatile, colorless liquid with a suffocating, fruity odor.

value.name: acetone
value.description: Acetone is the simplest and most widely used ketone, famous as the primary ingredient in nail polish remover. It is an exceptionally effective solvent for many plastics and synthetic fibers. In the human body, it is produced during ketosis and is a common metabolic byproduct.

value.name: acetophenone
value.description: Acetophenone is the simplest aromatic ketone and has a pleasant floral scent resembling hawthorn or cherry. It is used as a fragrance ingredient in perfumes and soaps, and as a flavoring agent in foods. In medicine, it has a history of use as a sedative and hypnotic agent.

value.name: benzaldehyde
value.description: Benzaldehyde is the simplest aromatic aldehyde and the primary component of bitter almond oil. It has a characteristic, almond-like odor and is widely used in the food and fragrance industries. It is also an important intermediate in the synthesis of various pharmaceuticals and specialty chemicals.

value.name: butyraldehyde
value.description: Butyraldehyde is a four-carbon aldehyde used primarily as an intermediate in the production of plasticizers and higher alcohols like 2-ethylhexanol. It has a sharp, acrid odor that becomes unpleasant at high concentrations. It is a highly flammable liquid used extensively in the plastics industry.

value.name: cyclohexanone
value.description: Cyclohexanone is a cyclic ketone that is a crucial intermediate in the industrial production of nylon. It is produced by the oxidation of cyclohexane and is then converted into adipic acid and caprolactam. It is a colorless to pale yellow oily liquid with a peppermint-like odor.

value.name: diethyl_ketone
value.description: Diethyl ketone, or 3-pentanone, is a symmetric ketone used as a solvent in paint and as a precursor to various organic molecules. It has a smell similar to acetone but less sharp. It is frequently used in the synthesis of vitamins and pharmaceutical intermediates.

value.name: formaldehyde
value.description: Formaldehyde is the simplest aldehyde and a highly reactive gas. It is most famous as a preservative for biological specimens (formalin) and as a key component in resins used for plywood and insulation. Despite its wide use, it is a known human carcinogen and a significant indoor air pollutant.

value.name: hexanal
value.description: Hexanal is a six-carbon aldehyde that contributes to the 'green' or 'grassy' aroma of many fruits and vegetables. it is also a marker of fat oxidation in food products, often associated with a rancid smell as it ages. It is used in the fragrance industry to add fresh, fruity notes to perfumes.

value.name: methyl_ethyl_ketone
value.description: Methyl ethyl ketone (MEK), also known as butanone, is a powerful industrial solvent used in the production of gums, resins, and cellulose acetate. It is a common ingredient in paint removers and specialized adhesives. MEK is highly effective at dissolving many plastics where other solvents might fail.

value.name: propionaldehyde
value.description: Propionaldehyde is a three-carbon aldehyde used as a precursor to various plastics and specialty chemicals. It is a colorless liquid with a suffocating odor and is produced primarily by the hydroformylation of ethylene. It is highly reactive and often used as a building block in organic synthesis.

value.name: succinaldehyde
value.description: Succinaldehyde is a highly reactive dialdehyde used as a cross-linking agent in biochemistry and as a precursor to various heterocyclic compounds like pyrroles. It is notoriously unstable in its pure form and is often handled as a stabilized derivative. It is an important intermediate in the synthesis of tropane alkaloids.

value.name: acetic_acid
value.description: Acetic acid is the organic acid that gives vinegar its characteristic sour taste and pungent smell. It is one of the most important industrial chemicals, used to produce vinyl acetate monomer for paints and adhesives. In its pure form, it is called 'glacial' acetic acid because it freezes into ice-like crystals.

value.name: adipic_acid
value.description: Adipic acid is a dicarboxylic acid that is a vital precursor in the production of nylon-6,6. It is a white crystalline solid produced on a massive scale globally. It is also used as a food additive to provide a tart flavor and as a component in some specialized biodegradable plastics.

value.name: benzoic_acid
value.description: Benzoic acid is a simple aromatic carboxylic acid and a common food preservative in the form of its salt, sodium benzoate. It occurs naturally in many plants and fruits, such as cranberries. It is also an important starting material for the synthesis of many other organic compounds and fragrances.

value.name: butyric_acid
value.description: Butyric acid is famously responsible for the unpleasant, rancid odor of spoiled butter and body odor. It is a short-chain fatty acid produced by the fermentation of fiber by the gut microbiome, where it plays a key role in maintaining colon health. It is also used as a precursor to many pleasant-smelling esters.

value.name: caproic_acid
value.description: Caproic acid, or hexanoic acid, is a six-carbon fatty acid with an odor reminiscent of goats or sweaty socks. It occurs naturally in various fats and oils, including those of goats and coconut. It is used in the production of esters for fragrances and as an intermediate in industrial chemical synthesis.

value.name: formic_acid
value.description: Formic acid is the simplest carboxylic acid and is famous for being found in the venom of many ants (the Latin word for ant is 'formica'). It is a colorless, pungent liquid used as a preservative in livestock feed and as a descaling agent in industrial cleaning. It is also a key participant in many organic reactions.

value.name: lactic_acid
value.description: Lactic acid is a vital hydroxy acid produced in muscles during intense exercise and by bacteria during the fermentation of yogurt and sauerkraut. It is widely used in the food industry as a preservative and as a building block for polylactic acid (PLA), a popular biodegradable 3D printing plastic.

value.name: oxalic_acid
value.description: Oxalic acid is a dicarboxylic acid found naturally in many vegetables like spinach and rhubarb. It is a strong organic acid used as a cleaning agent to remove rust and ink stains. In the human body, it can form calcium oxalate, which is the primary component of most kidney stones.

value.name: propionic_acid
value.description: Propionic acid is a three-carbon carboxylic acid used as a preservative in bread and baked goods to prevent mold growth. It is produced by certain bacteria and is responsible for the characteristic flavor and holes in Swiss cheese. It has a pungent, sour odor similar to acetic acid.

value.name: salicylic_acid
value.description: Salicylic acid is an aromatic hydroxy acid famous for its use in acne treatments and as the precursor to aspirin. It is a natural plant hormone derived from willow bark that has been used for pain relief for millennia. Its dual nature as an acid and a phenol makes it a versatile chemical building block.

value.name: terephthalic_acid
value.description: Terephthalic acid is a dicarboxylic acid that is a fundamental component of PET (polyethylene terephthalate) plastic. It is used on a massive scale to produce beverage bottles and polyester fibers for clothing. It is a white crystalline solid that is produced by the oxidation of p-xylene.

value.name: valeric_acid
value.description: Valeric acid is a five-carbon carboxylic acid with a very unpleasant and persistent odor. It is found naturally in valerian root and is used as a starting material for the synthesis of specialty esters and pharmaceuticals. Its structure is a key model for studying the properties of medium-chain fatty acids.

value.name: acetamide
value.description: Acetamide is the simplest primary amide and is used as a solvent and a plasticizer in various industrial applications. It is a colorless, crystalline solid that can have a mousy odor when impure. It is an important building block in the synthesis of many drugs and specialized chemical compounds.

value.name: acetic_anhydride
value.description: Acetic anhydride is a highly reactive acid anhydride used primarily as an acetylation agent. It is essential for the production of cellulose acetate (used in films and fibers) and for the synthesis of aspirin. Because it is also used to produce heroin from morphine, it is a strictly controlled substance in many countries.

value.name: acetyl_chloride
value.description: Acetyl chloride is a highly reactive and corrosive acyl halide used to introduce acetyl groups into other molecules. It reacts violently with water to release clouds of hydrochloric acid. In the laboratory, it is a critical reagent for the synthesis of esters, amides, and various other acylated compounds.

value.name: benzoyl_chloride
value.description: Benzoyl chloride is an aromatic acyl halide used as a reagent for introducing benzoyl groups into organic molecules. It is a pungent liquid that acts as a lachrymator (tear-inducing agent). It is an essential intermediate in the production of dyes, pharmaceuticals, and peroxide initiators for plastics.

value.name: caprolactam
value.description: Caprolactam is a cyclic amide that serves as the monomer for the production of nylon-6. It is a white solid produced on a large scale by the Beckmann rearrangement of cyclohexanone oxime. Caprolactam's ability to undergo ring-opening polymerization is the foundation of a major part of the global synthetic fiber industry.

value.name: dimethylformamide
value.description: Dimethylformamide (DMF) is a common polar aprotic solvent used in organic synthesis and industrial processes. It is often called the 'universal solvent' because it can dissolve many substances that are insoluble in other solvents. DMF is essential for the production of acrylic fibers, pharmaceuticals, and pesticides.

value.name: dimethyl_carbonate
value.description: Dimethyl carbonate is a versatile 'green' chemical used as a solvent and as a methylation agent. It is often considered a safer alternative to more toxic reagents like dimethyl sulfate or phosgene. It is also used as an electrolyte component in lithium-ion batteries and as a fuel additive.

value.name: ethyl_acetate
value.description: Ethyl acetate is a widely used ester solvent known for its pleasant, fruity smell, often associated with pear drops or nail polish remover. it is a common solvent for glues, lacquers, and decaffeinating coffee and tea. It is also found naturally in many fruits and is a byproduct of fermentation.

value.name: ethyl_acetoacetate
value.description: Ethyl acetoacetate is a versatile ester used as a building block in the synthesis of many pharmaceuticals, dyes, and fragrances. It is famous for displaying keto-enol tautomerism, where it exists as a mixture of two structural forms. It is also a key starting material in the Hantzsch pyridine synthesis.

value.name: methyl_acetate
value.description: Methyl acetate is a volatile ester solvent with a smell similar to ethyl acetate. It is used in the production of fast-drying lacquers, adhesives, and as a starting material in various chemical syntheses. It is a colorless liquid that is less toxic than many other common industrial solvents.

value.name: methyl_benzoate
value.description: Methyl benzoate is an aromatic ester with a pleasant, sweet smell resembling feijoa or tuberose. it is used in the fragrance industry and as a flavoring agent in foods. It is also used as a specialty solvent and as an intermediate in the synthesis of other aromatic compounds.

value.name: succinic_anhydride
value.description: Succinic anhydride is a cyclic acid anhydride used as a starting material for the synthesis of many pharmaceuticals and resins. It is a white solid that reacts readily with alcohols and amines to form succinate esters and amides. It is an important reagent in the production of specialized polymers.

value.name: aniline
value.description: Aniline is the simplest aromatic amine and a cornerstone of the global chemical industry. It is a primary precursor to polyurethanes, dyes, and many pharmaceuticals. Aniline is a colorless oily liquid that turns brown upon exposure to air and is highly toxic, known for its ability to interfere with oxygen transport in the blood.

value.name: benzylamine
value.description: Benzylamine is an aromatic primary amine used as an intermediate in the production of many drugs and agrochemicals. It is a colorless liquid with a characteristic amine odor and acts as a versatile building block in organic synthesis. It is also used as a chemical precursor in the manufacture of specialized coatings.

value.name: diethylamine
value.description: Diethylamine is a secondary amine used primarily in the production of corrosion inhibitors and in the synthesis of various drugs and resins. It has a strong, fishy, or ammonia-like odor and is a colorless liquid. It is a versatile base and nucleophile in many organic chemical reactions.

value.name: dimethylamine
value.description: Dimethylamine is a simple secondary amine with a pungent, fishy odor. It is a vital feedstock for many industrial chemicals, including the solvent DMF and various surfactants. It exists as a gas at room temperature and is typically handled as a solution in water or as a liquefied gas.

value.name: ethylamine
value.description: Ethylamine is a primary amine used as an intermediate in the production of herbicides and various specialty chemicals. It is a colorless gas with a strong ammonia-like odor and is highly soluble in water. It is a basic molecule used to introduce ethyl groups into other organic structures.

value.name: hexamethylenediamine
value.description: Hexamethylenediamine is a six-carbon diamine that is a critical building block for the production of nylon-6,6. It is a white crystalline solid produced on a massive scale by the hydrogenation of adiponitrile. Its ability to form strong hydrogen bonds is key to the high strength and durability of nylon fibers.

value.name: isopropylamine
value.description: Isopropylamine is a primary amine used as an intermediate in the production of herbicides, such as glyphosate, and in various pharmaceutical syntheses. It is a highly volatile, colorless liquid with a strong odor. Its branched structure provides it with unique reactivity compared to other alkylamines.

value.name: methylamine
value.description: Methylamine is the simplest primary amine and a vital industrial chemical used to produce everything from solvents like NMP to pharmaceuticals like ephedrine. It has a strong fishy odor and is a colorless gas. In popular culture, it is famously associated with the clandestine synthesis of methamphetamine.

value.name: n_n-diisopropylethylamine
value.description: N,N-Diisopropylethylamine, also known as Hunig's base, is a bulky tertiary amine used in organic synthesis as a non-nucleophilic base. Its large size prevents it from reacting as a nucleophile, making it ideal for reactions where a base is needed but substitution must be avoided. It is a clear, pungent liquid.

value.name: propylamine
value.description: Propylamine is a primary amine used as an intermediate in the synthesis of various drugs and pesticides. It is a colorless liquid with a strong, fishy odor and acts as a basic building block in many organic chemical processes. It is also used as a solvent in certain specialized industrial applications.

value.name: triethylamine
value.description: Triethylamine is a common tertiary amine used as a base in organic synthesis, particularly for forming esters and amides. It is a volatile liquid with a strong fishy odor and is often used to neutralize acids produced during reactions. It is a quintessential reagent in the modern organic chemistry laboratory.

value.name: trimethylamine
value.description: Trimethylamine is a tertiary amine famous for its intense, rotting-fish odor. It is produced by the breakdown of plants and animals and is responsible for the smell of stale fish. Industrially, it is used as a feedstock for producing choline, various surfactants, and many other specialty chemicals.

value.name: glycine
value.description: Glycine is the simplest of all amino acids and the only one that is not chiral. It is a vital building block for proteins and serves as an inhibitory neurotransmitter in the central nervous system. Its small size allows it to fit into tight spaces within protein structures, such as the triple helix of collagen.

value.name: l-alanine
value.description: L-Alanine is a non-polar amino acid and a key player in the glucose-alanine cycle, which helps transport nitrogen and energy between muscles and the liver. It is one of the most abundant amino acids in most proteins and is essential for metabolic regulation. It has a simple methyl side chain.

value.name: l-arginine
value.description: L-Arginine is a basic amino acid with a complex side chain that plays a crucial role in the urea cycle and the production of nitric oxide, a signaling molecule for blood vessel dilation. It is classified as 'semi-essential' because the body can produce it, but supplemental amounts are often needed during growth or stress.

value.name: l-asparagine
value.description: L-Asparagine was the first amino acid to be isolated from its natural source (asparagus). It is a polar amino acid with an amide side chain and is essential for the structure of many proteins where it often participates in hydrogen bonding. It is also a key player in the transport and storage of nitrogen.

value.name: l-aspartic_acid
value.description: L-Aspartic acid is an acidic amino acid that carries a negative charge at physiological pH. It is a key intermediate in the urea cycle and is involved in the synthesis of other amino acids and nucleotides. In the brain, it acts as an excitatory neurotransmitter, participating in various signaling pathways.

value.name: l-glutamic_acid
value.description: L-Glutamic acid is the most abundant excitatory neurotransmitter in the human brain, playing a central role in learning and memory. It is also famous for providing the 'umami' or savory flavor in food when present as monosodium glutamate (MSG). It is a vital molecule for both nerve signaling and metabolism.

value.name: l-glutamine
value.description: L-Glutamine is the most abundant free amino acid in human blood and a primary fuel for rapidly dividing cells like those in the immune system and gut lining. It serves as a major nitrogen carrier and is crucial for maintaining acid-base balance in the body. It is often used as a supplement for muscle recovery.

value.name: l-histidine
value.description: L-Histidine is an essential amino acid with a unique imidazole side chain that allows it to participate in both acid-base catalysis and metal binding in proteins. It is the precursor to histamine, a vital signaling molecule for immune and allergic responses. Histidine is particularly important for the function of hemoglobin.

value.name: l-isoleucine
value.description: L-Isoleucine is a branched-chain essential amino acid (BCAA) that plays a key role in energy metabolism and muscle tissue maintenance. It is an isomer of leucine and possesses two chiral centers, making its structure more complex. It is critical for the production of hemoglobin and the regulation of blood sugar levels.

value.name: l-leucine
value.description: L-Leucine is a branched-chain essential amino acid that is the primary driver of muscle protein synthesis via the mTOR signaling pathway. It is the most abundant BCAA and is crucial for muscle growth and repair. Because the body cannot produce it, it must be obtained through protein-rich foods or supplements.

value.name: l-lysine
value.description: L-Lysine is an essential basic amino acid that is critical for the synthesis of collagen and the absorption of calcium. It plays a vital role in the production of enzymes, hormones, and antibodies, helping to support the immune system. Lysine is often used as a supplement to manage symptoms of certain viral infections.

value.name: l-phenylalanine
value.description: L-Phenylalanine is an essential aromatic amino acid that serves as the precursor for tyrosine, which in turn leads to the production of dopamine, adrenaline, and melanin. It is found in many high-protein foods and is also a component of the artificial sweetener aspartame. It is vital for brain function and mood regulation.

value.name: l-proline
value.description: L-Proline is unique among amino acids because its side chain cyclicly bonds back to the nitrogen of the backbone, creating a rigid structure. This rigidity is essential for the formation of the triple helix structure of collagen, the body's most abundant protein. Proline is a key player in wound healing and skin health.

value.name: l-pyrrolysine
value.description: L-Pyrrolysine is a rare '22nd amino acid' found only in certain methane-producing microbes. It is encoded by the UAG 'stop' codon in a specialized context, demonstrating the surprising flexibility of the genetic code. It is essential for the function of enzymes involved in the methanogenesis pathway.

value.name: l-serine
value.description: L-Serine is a polar amino acid that is a key building block for many biological molecules, including phosphatidylserine, which is vital for cell membranes. It is also a precursor to the amino acids glycine and cysteine. Serine plays a central role in the metabolism of one-carbon units and is critical for brain development.

value.name: l-threonine
value.description: L-Threonine is an essential polar amino acid that is a primary component of structural proteins like collagen and elastin. It is also vital for the production of antibodies and the maintenance of a healthy immune system. Threonine is unique for its hydroxyl group, which can undergo phosphorylation in signaling pathways.

value.name: l-tryptophan
value.description: L-Tryptophan is an essential aromatic amino acid famous as the precursor for the neurotransmitter serotonin and the sleep hormone melatonin. It is found in many proteins and is often associated with the 'sleepy' feeling after a large turkey meal. Tryptophan is also a precursor for the production of the vitamin niacin (B3).

value.name: l-tyrosine
value.description: L-Tyrosine is a non-essential aromatic amino acid produced from phenylalanine. It is a critical precursor for the neurotransmitters dopamine, noradrenaline, and adrenaline, as well as thyroid hormones. Tyrosine is vital for alertness, mood regulation, and the body's response to stress.

value.name: l-valine
value.description: L-Valine is a branched-chain essential amino acid (BCAA) that is crucial for muscle tissue repair, energy production, and nitrogen balance in the body. Along with leucine and isoleucine, it is a primary fuel for muscles during intense exercise. Valine is essential for growth and maintaining a healthy nervous system.

value.name: dichloromethane
value.description: Dichloromethane (DCM), also known as methylene chloride, is a widely used industrial solvent for paint stripping, metal cleaning, and caffeine extraction. It is a volatile, colorless liquid with a sweet, chloroform-like odor. While effective, it is highly toxic and regulated due to its potential carcinogenicity and neurological effects.

value.name: freon_134a
value.description: Freon 134a, or 1,1,1,2-tetrafluoroethane, is a haloalkane used primarily as a refrigerant in automotive air conditioning and as a propellant in aerosols. It was designed as a replacement for CFCs because it does not deplete the ozone layer, though it is a potent greenhouse gas. It is a colorless gas that is typically handled as a liquid under pressure.

value.name: vinyl_chloride
value.description: Vinyl chloride is a critical industrial chemical used almost exclusively as the monomer for the production of polyvinyl chloride (PVC) plastic. It is a colorless gas with a sweet odor and is highly flammable. Vinyl chloride is a well-known human carcinogen, and its handling and emissions are strictly controlled to protect workers and the environment.

value.name: 1_2_4-triazole
value.description: 1,2,4-Triazole is a five-membered heterocyclic compound with three nitrogen atoms. Its ring structure is a key building block in many antifungal medications (like fluconazole) and various agrochemicals. Its ability to coordinate with metal ions and participate in complex hydrogen bonding makes it a versatile tool in medicinal chemistry.

value.name: furan
value.description: Furan is a five-membered heterocyclic aromatic compound that features one oxygen atom in the ring. It is a highly volatile, flammable liquid with a smell similar to ether. Furans are found naturally in many cooked foods and serve as important intermediates in the synthesis of various specialty chemicals and pharmaceuticals.

value.name: imidazole
value.description: Imidazole is a five-membered heterocycle with two nitrogen atoms that is essential for life, forming the side chain of the amino acid histidine. It is an aromatic molecule that plays a key role as a biological buffer and as a catalyst in many enzymatic reactions. Imidazole derivatives are also widely used in various medications and industrial processes.

value.name: isoxazole
value.description: Isoxazole is a five-membered heterocycle containing one oxygen and one nitrogen atom adjacent to each other. Its ring system is a common motif in many pharmaceutical drugs, particularly those with antibacterial and cox-2 inhibitory properties. Its unique electronic properties make it a valuable building block in organic synthesis.

value.name: oxazole
value.description: Oxazole is a five-membered heterocycle with one oxygen and one nitrogen atom separated by one carbon atom. It is an aromatic molecule and a common component of many natural products and pharmaceuticals. Oxazoles are particularly useful in organic synthesis as masked carboxylic acids and as precursors to other heterocyclic ring systems.

value.name: pyrazine
value.description: Pyrazine is a six-membered heterocyclic aromatic compound with two nitrogen atoms in the 1 and 4 positions. Pyrazine derivatives are responsible for many of the characteristic 'toasty' or 'earthy' aromas in roasted foods like coffee, chocolate, and popcorn. They are also important intermediates in the synthesis of pharmaceuticals.

value.name: pyridine
value.description: Pyridine is a six-membered heterocycle with one nitrogen atom, similar to benzene but with one carbon replaced by nitrogen. It is a versatile basic solvent and a common intermediate in the production of agrochemicals and pharmaceuticals. It has a notoriously unpleasant and penetrating fishy odor that is difficult to forget.

value.name: pyrimidine
value.description: Pyrimidine is a six-membered heterocycle with two nitrogen atoms that serves as the foundation for the nucleobases cytosine, thymine, and uracil in DNA and RNA. its ring system is one of the most important in biochemistry, participating in the storage and transfer of genetic information and in various metabolic pathways.

value.name: pyrrole
value.description: Pyrrole is a five-membered heterocyclic aromatic compound with one nitrogen atom. Its ring is a fundamental building block for many essential biological molecules, including heme (in blood) and chlorophyll (in plants). Pyrrole derivatives are also used in the production of specialized polymers and various pharmaceutical drugs.

value.name: tetrazole
value.description: Tetrazole is a five-membered heterocycle containing four nitrogen atoms, the highest possible nitrogen content for a stable ring. It is an acidic aromatic molecule often used as a bioisostere for the carboxylic acid group in medicinal chemistry. Tetrazole derivatives are also used in automotive air bags and as high-energy materials.

value.name: acetylcholine
value.description: Acetylcholine was the first neurotransmitter to be discovered and is essential for muscle contraction and the regulation of heart rate. In the brain, it plays a vital role in attention, memory, and learning processes. It is a key molecule of the parasympathetic nervous system, helping the body to 'rest and digest'.

value.name: adrenaline
value.description: Adrenaline, also known as epinephrine, is both a hormone and a neurotransmitter that triggers the body's 'fight-or-flight' response. Produced by the adrenal glands during stress or excitement, it increases heart rate, blood pressure, and energy supply. It is a vital medication used in emergencies to treat severe allergic reactions and cardiac arrest.

value.name: anandamide
value.description: Anandamide is an endocannabinoid neurotransmitter often called the 'bliss molecule' due to its role in regulating mood, pain, and appetite. Its name is derived from the Sanskrit word 'ananda', meaning supreme joy. It binds to the same receptors as THC from cannabis, helping to maintain homeostatic balance in the nervous system.

value.name: beta-alanine
value.description: beta-Alanine is a naturally occurring amino acid that acts as a neurotransmitter and a building block for carnosine, which helps buffer acid in muscles during high-intensity exercise. It is widely used as a dietary supplement by athletes to improve performance and reduce fatigue. It is unique for being a beta-amino acid rather than the more common alpha type.

value.name: dopamine
value.description: Dopamine is the brain's primary 'reward' neurotransmitter, playing a central role in motivation, pleasure, and motor control. It is vital for the signaling of anticipation and the reinforcement of behavior. Imbalances in dopamine levels are associated with various conditions, including Parkinson's disease, addiction, and schizophrenia.

value.name: gamma-aminobutyric_acid
value.description: gamma-Aminobutyric acid (GABA) is the primary inhibitory neurotransmitter in the adult human brain, responsible for reducing neuronal excitability and promoting a sense of calm. It acts like a 'brake' on the nervous system, helping to regulate anxiety and stress. Many sedative and anti-anxiety medications work by enhancing the effects of GABA.

value.name: histamine
value.description: Histamine is a neurotransmitter and immune signaling molecule famous for its role in allergic reactions and the regulation of stomach acid. In the brain, it helps maintain wakefulness, alertness, and cognitive function. Antihistamines, often taken for allergies, can cause drowsiness by blocking histamine's wake-promoting signals in the brain.

value.name: melatonin
value.description: Melatonin is a hormone produced by the pineal gland that acts as the body's primary signal for sleep and circadian rhythm regulation. Its production increases in response to darkness, helping to synchronize the body's internal clock with the environment. It is also a powerful antioxidant that protects cells from oxidative stress and damage.

value.name: noradrenaline
value.description: Noradrenaline, or norepinephrine, is a catecholamine that acts as both a hormone and a neurotransmitter, primarily involved in the brain's 'alert and orient' system. It increases heart rate and blood flow during stress, enhancing focused attention and responsiveness. It is a key player in the sympathetic nervous system's response to challenges.

value.name: serotonin
value.description: Serotonin is a vital neurotransmitter often called the 'happiness molecule' due to its profound influence on mood, anxiety, and well-being. Found primarily in the gut and brain, it also regulates sleep, appetite, and bone health. Most antidepressant medications work by increasing the availability of serotonin in the spaces between nerve cells.

value.name: amphetamine
value.description: Amphetamine is a potent stimulant of the central nervous system used to treat ADHD and narcolepsy. It works by increasing the levels of dopamine and noradrenaline in the brain, improving focus and alertness. While medically useful, it has a high potential for abuse and is a common recreational drug of misuse.

value.name: caffeine
value.description: Caffeine is the most widely consumed psychoactive substance in the world, found naturally in coffee, tea, and cacao. It works by blocking adenosine receptors in the brain, which prevents drowsiness and increases alertness. For many, it is a daily ritual that helps kickstart cognitive function and physical energy.

value.name: cocaine
value.description: Cocaine is a powerful and highly addictive stimulant alkaloid derived from the leaves of the coca plant. It acts as a triple reuptake inhibitor, rapidly increasing levels of dopamine, serotonin, and noradrenaline in the brain's reward system. While used historically as a local anesthetic, it is now primarily an illegal recreational drug with high health risks.

value.name: dmt
value.description: N,N-Dimethyltryptamine (DMT) is a potent psychedelic tryptamine found in many plants and produced in trace amounts in the human body. It is the primary psychoactive component of the Amazonian brew ayahuasca and is known for producing intense, short-lived visual and auditory hallucinations. It is often referred to as the 'spirit molecule'.

value.name: fentanyl
value.description: Fentanyl is an extremely potent synthetic opioid analgesic, up to 100 times stronger than morphine. It is used medically for the management of severe pain, particularly in cancer patients and during surgery. Due to its extreme potency, even tiny amounts can cause a fatal overdose, making it a major driver of the global opioid crisis.

value.name: ghb
value.description: gamma-Hydroxybutyrate (GHB) is a naturally occurring neurotransmitter and a central nervous system depressant used medically to treat narcolepsy. It is also known as a recreational drug of abuse and a 'date rape' drug due to its ability to cause profound sedation and memory loss. It acts primarily through the GHB and GABA-B receptors.

value.name: heroin
value.description: Heroin, or diacetylmorphine, is a highly addictive semi-synthetic opioid drug synthesized from morphine. It rapidly crosses the blood-brain barrier and is converted back into morphine, producing an intense surge of euphoria. Heroin use is associated with severe long-term health consequences and a high risk of fatal overdose through respiratory depression.

value.name: lsd
value.description: Lysergic acid diethylamide (LSD) is one of the most potent psychedelic chemicals known, capable of producing profound changes in perception, thought, and mood. Produced from ergot fungus, it was a central part of the 1960s counterculture and is now being researched for its potential to treat various mental health disorders in controlled settings.

value.name: mdma
value.description: MDMA, commonly known as ecstasy or molly, is a synthetic empathogen with both stimulant and mild psychedelic properties. It works primarily by causing a massive release of serotonin in the brain, leading to increased feelings of empathy, social connectedness, and euphoria. It is currently being studied for its potential to treat PTSD.

value.name: mescaline
value.description: Mescaline is a naturally occurring psychedelic protoalkaloid found in certain cacti, most notably the peyote cactus. It has a long history of use by indigenous peoples in North America for religious and healing ceremonies. It produces visual hallucinations and altered states of consciousness similar to LSD but with its own unique character.

value.name: methamphetamine
value.description: Methamphetamine is a highly addictive and neurotoxic stimulant drug that is more potent and longer-lasting than amphetamine. It produces an intense rush followed by long periods of hyper-alertness. Chronic use can lead to severe physical and psychological damage, including 'meth mouth', skin sores, and significant cognitive decline.

value.name: nicotine
value.description: Nicotine is a stimulant alkaloid found naturally in the tobacco plant and is responsible for the addictive nature of smoking and vaping. It works primarily by activating nicotinic acetylcholine receptors in the brain, leading to the release of dopamine. While it can improve focus and reduce anxiety in the short term, its long-term use is a major cause of preventable disease.

value.name: oxycodone
value.description: Oxycodone is a semi-synthetic opioid medication used for the management of moderate to severe pain. It is the active ingredient in widely prescribed painkillers like OxyContin. While highly effective for pain relief, it has been at the center of the prescription opioid epidemic due to its high potential for addiction and misuse.

value.name: pcp
value.description: Phencyclidine (PCP), also known as 'angel dust', is a dissociative anesthetic that can cause hallucinations, distorted perceptions of sounds, and violent behavior. It works primarily as an NMDA receptor antagonist. PCP was originally developed as an anesthetic for medical use but was discontinued due to its severe psychological side effects.

value.name: thc
value.description: delta-9-Tetrahydrocannabinol (THC) is the primary psychoactive component of the cannabis plant. It works by mimicking the body's natural endocannabinoids and binding to CB1 receptors in the brain, leading to the well-known 'high' along with analgesic and anti-inflammatory effects. It is used both recreationally and medically for various conditions.

value.name: aspirin
value.description: Aspirin, or acetylsalicylic acid, is a nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID) with a long history of use for relieving pain, reducing fever, and decreasing inflammation. It works by irreversibly blocking COX-1 and COX-2 enzymes, thereby preventing the production of prostaglandins. In addition to these effects, aspirin has a unique antiplatelet (blood-thinning) action. At low doses, it is commonly used to prevent blood clots, which can help reduce the risk of heart attacks and strokes in high-risk individuals.

value.name: ibuprofen
value.description: Ibuprofen is a widely used NSAID medication for treating pain, fever, and inflammation. Unlike aspirin, its inhibition of COX enzymes is reversible. It is a common choice for managing symptoms of arthritis, menstrual cramps, and minor injuries. It is one of the most frequently used over-the-counter medications in the world due to its effective balance of efficacy and safety profile.

value.name: lisinopril
value.description: Lisinopril is a medication belonging to the ACE inhibitor class, used primarily to treat high blood pressure and heart failure. It works by preventing the body from producing angiotensin II, a substance that narrows blood vessels, thereby allowing vessels to relax and blood pressure to drop. It is also often prescribed to improve survival after a heart attack and to protect the kidneys in patients with diabetes.

value.name: metformin
value.description: Metformin is the first-line medication for the treatment of type 2 diabetes. It works primarily by reducing glucose production in the liver and increasing the body's sensitivity to insulin. Unlike many other diabetes medications, it does not typically cause weight gain or a high risk of low blood sugar. Metformin is also being researched for its potential anti-aging and cancer-preventive properties.

value.name: metoprolol
value.description: Metoprolol is a beta-blocker medication used to treat high blood pressure, chest pain (angina), and to prevent further heart problems after a heart attack. It works by blocking the action of adrenaline on the heart, slowing the heart rate and reducing the strain on the cardiac muscle. It is also commonly used to prevent migraines and to treat certain types of tremors.

value.name: paracetamol
value.description: Paracetamol, also known as acetaminophen, is a common medication used to treat pain and fever. While its exact mechanism of action is still being studied, it is thought to work primarily by inhibiting prostaglandin synthesis in the central nervous system. It is often preferred over NSAIDs for people with stomach issues or those at risk of bleeding, but it must be taken carefully as high doses can cause severe liver damage.
